job_title: Financial Services Representative in Boise, ID
pros: Good benefits for Health Insurance, Vison and Dental. Good time off accrual
cons: Sick pay is only used after 2 consecutive days of being sick. The first 2 days must come from time off accrual (this is looking at being changed)

job_title: Marketing and Communications Coordinator in Boise, ID
pros: You have access to content experts throughout the organization, and all are there to help each other succeed and to promote themselves in the process.
cons: Space to work may be problematic but the options to WFH are available as needed which is nice.

job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Boise, ID
pros: One hour lunches, lots of learning opportunities
cons: Drama and gossip, poor management, favoritism

job_title: Front Desk Medical Receptionist in Nampa, ID
pros: I enjoy the location I’m at

job_title: Certified Medical Coder in Boise, ID
pros: Great place to work for advancement, coworkers are great, and everyone is striving to better lives of the underserved. Expanding greatly now and in the near future. Company paid for certification, while on the job training. Great place to work.
cons: Out growing themselves and space is tight.

review_title: Growing company with values and patient care.
pros: Cares about patients and staff. Welcomes everyone.
cons: Rapid growth changes culture and communication can be difficult.
